title: Girl rejects man's advances, pushed in front of train, loses legs & arm
description: A 17-year-old girl in Bareilly lost both her legs and left arm after being pushed in front of a moving train by her stalker. She is in critical condition and receiving treatment in a private hospital. Three police personnel, including the SHO, have been suspended for negligence. The victim's parents will receive immediate compensation of Rs 5 lakh and the government will cover the cost of her treatment.

title: Himanta slams CWC stand on Hamas hit
description: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma criticized the Congress party for its stance on the Israel-Palestine conflict, claiming that their resolution resembled statements made by Pakistan and the Taliban. Sarma highlighted three aspects: the absence of condemnation towards Hamas, failure to denounce terror attacks on Israel, and silence on the issue of hostages.

title: Man who housed pro-Khalistan terrorists gets Canada asylum
description: An immigration tribunal in Canada has ruled that a Sikh man who provided shelter and food to Khalistani militants in India should be allowed into the country. The tribunal stated that the man did so out of necessity and fear of retribution. The Canada Border Services Agency argued that he should be ineligible due to his involvement in subversion by force.

title: Biden calls Hamas attacks deadliest for Jews since the Holocaust
description: US president Joe Biden on Wednesday condemned the weekend attack by Hamas militants on Israel as the deadliest day for Jews since the Holocaust as the number of US citizens killed in the fighting ticked up to at least 22. “This attack was a campaign of pure cruelty — not just hate, but pure cruelty — against the Jewish people,” Biden told Jewish leaders gathered at the White House.

title: RSS chief: India showed the world is one family
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said the world could learn from India not only unity in diversity but also diversity in unity as he stressed that global security lies in respect to the essence of humanity. "We are one, this is the reality. There is the feeling that we are different but the spirit of our Indian culture has been Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam," the RSS Chief expressed.

title: Pregnant UP woman stuck with hubby, kid in Tel Aviv shelter
description: Jaideep Kaur and her husband, Mohit Randhawa, who are currently in Israel, had to take shelter in a bunker due to the ongoing conflict. Kaur, who is six months pregnant, expressed gratitude for the safety provided by the bunker. The couple had limited access to news and communication, relying mostly on FaceTime to connect with their families.

title: SC 'respects' 82yo's wish to not die a divorcee, nixes hubby plea
description: More than two decades of legal battle for divorce sought by a former IAF officer, now 89 years old, culminated with the Supreme Court "respecting" the sentiments of the wife, 82, who contended that she did not want to die a divorcee, and rejected the plea of termination of marriage. The couple, based in Chandigarh and married for 60 years, tied the knot in 1963 and their marital life was normal till the IAF officer got transferred to then Madras in January 1984

title: Centre launches Op Ajay to evacuate Indians from Israel
description: In its first response to the Israel-Hamas war, the government Wednesday launched Operation Ajay to facilitate the return from Israel of Indian nationals who wish to return and set up a 24-hour control room to monitor the situation there. Foreign minister S Jaishankar said special charter flights and other arrangements were being made.

title: 76% of first-year students at IIT-Bombay claim 'academic stress'
description: Shaken by the suicide of a first-year student early this year, IIT-Bombay carried out a survey to gauge stress levels within its bright but rigorous academic environment. The results have now served to reinforce the views put forward by a high-level committee - an overwhelming number of freshers at the engineering school feel stressed, and they blame it on the competitive atmosphere on the campus.

title: As India expands global footprint, govt adds 215 IFS posts
description: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved the cadre review and restructuring proposal of Indian Foreign Service (IFS) to increase the cadre strength by around 215 in the next five years, a move that seeks to fulfil a long-felt need that had grown even more pressing because of the recent rise in India's influence and the desire to play big on the global stage.

title: CBI files FIR accusing NewsClick of FCRA violations
description: The CBI has filed an FIR against NewsClick, its directors and associates, alleging violations of the FCRA in connection with accusations that the online media outlet had received unexplained export remittances of Rs 28.5 crore from four foreign entities and unexplained foreign funds of Rs 9.6 crore by incorrectly characterising them as FDI. The agency conducted searches at the company's office and the residence of its director on Wednesday.

title: EC shuffles 38 senior officials in five poll-bound states
description: The Election Commission on Wednesday ordered immediate transfer of nine district magistrates, 25 senior police officials including superintendents of police and police commissioners and four secretary-level officers across five poll-bound states over "lax performance".

title: HC rejects PIL seeking recognition of mosque as Krishna Janmabhoomi
description: The Allahabad high court on Wednesday dismissed a PIL seeking recognition of Mathura’s Shahi Idgah Masjid as Krishna Janmabhoomi. A division bench comprising Chief Justice Pritinker Diwaker and Justice Ashutosh Srivastava passed the order while dismissing a PIL filed by Mahek Maheshwari, an advocate.

title: Pro-life or pro-choice? Split in SC bench of 2 women judges
description: The Supreme Court, which has traditionally been pro-life, was split Wednesday over choosing between stopping the heart of an over 26-week-old healthy fetus and the choice of its carrier, a married woman, to terminate the pregnancy which is impermissible under the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act.

title: At least 4 killed, several hurt as North East Express derails in Bihar
description: Several coaches of a superfast train going from Delhi's Anand Vihar Terminal to Assam's Kamakhya derailed at around 21.35pm on Wednesday near Raghunathpur station in Bihar.Several passengers are feared injured in the accident and rescue teams have been rushed to the spot. The injured passengers are being rushed to the nearest hospital.

title: Passenger train derails in Bihar, several feared injured
'It's crucial that we don't worry...': Rohit urges team ahead of Pak game
description: India's captain Rohit Sharma has urged his team to focus on "things we can control" as they prepare for the World Cup clash against arch-rivals Pakistan. India secured their second consecutive win in the World Cup with a resounding eight-wicket victory over Afghanistan, with Rohit playing a pivotal role in the triumph. Sharma stressed the importance of concentrating on elements within their control and dismissing external distractions. The team's next challenge is the mega World Cup clash against Pakistan, a match that cricket fans eagerly await.

title: Watch: Virat, Naveen bury the hatchet in heartwarming moment
description: In a delightful and heartwarming moment, Afghanistan's Naveen-Ul-Haq and India's Virat Kohli were seen sharing pleasantries during the World Cup game in New Delhi on Wednesday. The duo were involved in a heated clash in the IPL earlier this year, which at that point, became one of the most talked about moments of the tournament.

title: Will Cong vs AAP battle in states impact INDIA's efforts?
description: The upcoming assembly elections in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Chhattisgarh could see INDIA parties contesting against each other. The Congress, which is in direct competition with the BJP in these states, will have to contend with the presence of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), its ally in the anti-BJP front. Victory in these states would give the Congress an advantage and greater bargaining power in the opposition space. The AAP has announced its intention to contest in all three states.

title: ODI WC: Record breaking Rohit fires India to dominant win
description: Rohit Sharma oozed class and elegance en route to a recording-breaking hundred, leading India to an emphatic eight-wicket win over Afghanistan in the ODI World Cup in Delhi on Wednesday. Hasmatullah Shahidi's dogged 80 and the young Azmatullah Omarazai's gutsy 62 took Afghanistan to 272/8. On a batting beauty, India skipper Rohit (131 off 84) was unstoppable and flaunted his envious range of strokes. Indai chased down the with 90 balls to spare.

title: Harvard invites backlash over students' letter blaming Israel
description: Harvard University is facing backlash over an open letter written by its Palestine Solidarity Groups, blaming Israel for the violence in the region. The letter, signed by over 30 student groups, sparked outrage and calls for the university to release the names of the students involved. The controversy has drawn attention from figures such as investor Bill Ackman and former university President Larry Summers. Harvard's silence on the issue has further fueled criticism.

title: Titanic submersible debris, human remains recovered
description: The US Coast Guard has recovered more debris and suspected human remains from the submersible that imploded during an underwater voyage to view the Titanic. All five people on board the recreational sub were killed in the incident, which occurred in June. The Coast Guard is leading the investigation into the incident, which has raised concerns about the safety of private undersea exploration operations.

title: Rohit Sharma sets records with his seventh WC century
description: India skipper Rohit Sharma has become the batter with the most centuries in the ODI World Cups. In a match against Afghanistan, Sharma scored his seventh century in the tournament, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's six centuries. This marks his 31st century in One Day Internationals (ODIs), making him the third batter to achieve more than 30 centuries in this format. Other Indian cricketing legends include Sachin Tendulkar with 49 ODI centuries and Virat Kohli with 47.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 2200 lives lost on both sides
description: Tensions between Israel and Palestinians continue to escalate after Hamas launched an attack on Israel, resulting in casualties on both sides. The US has deployed its aircraft carrier group to the eastern Mediterranean in support of Israel. Hamas fired thousands of rockets into Israel, prompting Israel to declare war and expand its military mobilization.

title: 'Hitman' Rohit becomes leading six-hitter in int'l cricket
description: India captain Rohit Sharma has surpassed Chris Gayle as the batter with the most sixes in international cricket. Sharma achieved his 554th maximum in international cricket with a six off Naveen-ul-Haq in the 8th over of India's run chase against Afghanistan. Gayle had previously held the record with 553 sixes. Rohit's journey to reach the milestone was remarkable, taking just 30 balls to reach the milestone, showcasing his explosive batting prowess.

title: EC shunts top officials in 5 poll-bound states for laxity
First glimpse: Indian Railways readies push-pull Vande Bharat
description: Indian Railways has unveiled a swanky new WAP5 electric locomotive that will be used for its new train for the common man. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared the first glimpse of the push pull locomotive.

title: I lost my cousin and her husband in Israel: Madhura Naik
description: Madhura Naik shares how her cousin sister and her husband were killed in Israel on Saturday. The actress is heartbroken and has no words for the ongoing Israel war.

title: 'Rizwan gets cramps very often': Shoaib takes a dig at Pak batter
description: Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan and Abdullah Shafique slammed centuries in Pakistan's record highest successful World Cup run chase over the 1996 world champions Sri Lanka in Hyderabad.

title: 'Candy Crush' politics: Chhattisgarh CM's sugary saga amid poll buzz
description: Chhattisgarh's chief minister loves to play the online game 'Candy Crush,' and it's his favorite. The CM reacted mockingly to a BJP leader's criticism when a candid photo of him playing the game on his mobile phone was circulated on social media.

title: TCS sees 9% YoY rise in profit, beats estimates
description: TCS results: TCS' board recommended a second interim dividend of Rs 9 per share and approved a share buyback program totaling Rs 17,000 crore at Rs 4,150 per share.

title: Watch: Pak team arrives in Ahmedabad ahead of India game
description: Pakistan cricket team arrived in Ahmedabad for the World Cup clash against India, with fans eagerly awaiting the match. The team boarded a bus to their team hotel, where they will prepare for the crucial match. Supporter Bashir Chacha expressed optimism about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, the Indian batting duo, amid the excitement and anticipation. The atmosphere is electric and the Pakistani cricket team is ready for the pivotal match.

title: Israel's new Arab allies face 'very uncomfortable' situation
description: Arab countries that have recently normalized relations with Israel are finding it challenging to balance diplomacy with pro-Palestinian public opinion during the ongoing conflict. While the UAE condemned the kidnapping of Israeli hostages and provided humanitarian aid to the Palestinians, analysts predict that the situation will become increasingly troublesome as Israel's response intensifies. Other countries like Bahrain and Morocco have faced demonstrations in support of Palestinians.

title: Tesla-rival VinFast eyeing India entry
description: Vietnamese EV manufacturer VinFast Auto has announced its plans to invest up to USD 200 million (about Rs 1,665 crore) to set up assembly units in India and Indonesia, with production expected to commence by 2026.

title: EC changes Rajasthan polling date to Nov 25 from Nov 23
description: The Election Commission has changed the polling date in Rajasthan to November 25 due to large-scale weddings and social gatherings planned for November 23. The commission received requests from political parties and social organizations to change the date, citing logistical issues and potential voter inconvenience. The poll schedule for the other four states remains unchanged, with counting for all states to be held on December 3.

title: 'Either we die slowly or...': Hamas braces for Israel ground attack
description: Israeli warplanes have launched airstrikes on Gaza, potentially paving the way for a ground operation against Hamas. Over 200 targets were struck in a Gaza City neighborhood alleged to be used by Hamas. Israeli forces have repelled at least 1,000 Palestinian gunmen who infiltrated from Gaza. Hamas militants have threatened to execute captives for each Gaza home hit without warning. Hamas officials are preparing for a possible ground invasion and hope to incite rebellion in the occupied West Bank. Hamas also aims to draw regional sympathizers into the conflict and ignite a broader conflict with the "axis of resistance.

title: 'Free Palestine': Hundreds rally against Israel in Michigan
description: Hundreds of people gathered in Dearborn, Michigan, for a rally in support of the Palestinians following Hamas' attack on Israel. The protest took place at the Ford Community and Performing Arts Center, with chants of "Free free Palestine." European Union chief Ursula von der Leyen condemned Hamas' attack as a "cold-blooded act of war" and expressed full support for Israel's right to defend itself.

title: Shameful': Miss Universe selection sparks outrage in Pakistan
description: Pakistan's decision to send Erica Robin to represent the country at the Miss Universe beauty pageant has sparked outrage among conservatives. Beauty pageants are rare in Pakistan, and some believe that Robin, a Christian, does not represent the country's values. The backlash has prompted an official investigation, and Robin has defended her participation, stating that she wants to change the perception that Pakistan is a backward country.

title: EC changes polling date in Rajasthan to Nov 25 from Nov 23
description: The Election Commission on Wednesday revised the polling date for elections in Rajasthan to November 25 from November 23 in view of large-scale weddings and social gatherings on that day.The previous polling day in Rajasthan coincided with Dev Uthani Ekadashi, an auspicious occasion when more than 50,000 weddings are likely to take place in the state.The people involved in the business claimed that conducting polls on that day could hurt the voting percentage.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya's special birthday celebration
description: Hardik Pandya, a dynamic all-rounder in Indian cricket, celebrated his 30th birthday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on Wedensday. The celebrations added to the excitement as India face Afghanistan in their second World Cup game. Former India batter Gautam Gambhir and commentator Jatin Sapru joined the celebration with the star all-rounder. Official World Cup broadcaster Star Sports captured the festive spirit, featuring Pandya cutting a birthday cake and sharing it with Gambhir.

title: I enjoyed Prannoy's bronze more than my gold: Satwiksairaj
description: HS Prannoy won bronze in men's singles at Asian Games while Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty clinched gold in men's doubles. The Indian men had also won the team silver.

title: India, China brace for mass layoffs as world looks beyond fossil fuels
description: Mine closures will eliminate about 15% of global coal mining jobs by 2035, about 400,000 in total, according to a new report published by Global Energy Monitor this week. The figure is likely to rise to nearly 1 million by 2050 as the world turns to cheaper wind and solar power generation. Mining jobs lost to automation, efficiency and commodity cycles have become thorny political issues from the US to Europe to Australia.

title: Wipro to roll out salary hikes effective December 1
description: The Indian IT industry, valued at $245 billion, has been affected by a slowdown in tech spending, leading to deferred salary hikes and reduced variable pay for the 5.1 million people it employs.

title: 1971 Indo-Pak war: Destroyer of PNS Ghazi passes away
description: Commander Inder Singh, a war hero who sank the Pakistani submarine PNS Ghazi in 1971, passed away in Haryana. He was cremated with full state honors. The sinking of PNS Ghazi was a significant moment in the 1971 war. Singh, the captain of INS Rajput, was given the mission to be a decoy ship and successfully sank the submarine. He was awarded the Vir Chakra for his bravery.

title: Video shows body of man being dragged by car in Delhi
description: The person was identified as a taxi driver with residence in Haryana's Faridabad.

title: Doubtful for Pak game, Gill to reach Ahmedabad on Wednesday
description: Recovering from dengue fever, Shubman Gill may not be able to play in the World Cup match against Pakistan. While Gill is making progress in his recovery, it is uncertain whether he will be fit to play. He missed the opening match against Australia and the match against Afghanistan.

title: Vision Mercedes-Maybach 6 comes to India
description: After premiering at the Pebble Beach Concours d’Elegance in August 2023, the futuristic Vision Mercedes-Maybach 6 was showcased in Mumbai on October 11.

title: Madhura Naik opens up about receiving communal hate on social media
description: Actress Madhura Naik shared the tragic news of her sister and brother-in-law being killed in the Israel war on Instagram. She also revealed that her family has been receiving threats and communal hate on social media. She expressed her concern for her family's safety and requested prayers. Madhura shared her pain and grief over the loss and condemned the targeting she faced for being Jewish. ETimes TV expressed their support and prayed for the safety of Madhura Naik and her family.

title: 'This was for our brothers and sisters in Gaza': Rizwan
description: Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan scored an unbeaten 131 and guided Abdullah Shafique to 113 in their World Cup debut, helping Pakistan chase down 345 to secure a six-wicket win over Sri Lanka. Rizwan collapsed due to cramps but continued to play, ensuring his team's victory. He dedicated the win to the people of Gaza.

title: Israel-Hamas conflict may help Russia in war against Ukraine
description: The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas could benefit Russia by diverting US military aid and attention from Ukraine, while the rising oil prices bolster Moscow's economy. The Kremlin sees the conflict as a distraction for the US and Europe from the war in Ukraine. Israel's requests for military supplies from the US, such as Iron Dome missiles, could put pressure on supplies if a ground war in the Gaza Strip ensues.

title: Hamas attack: What may happen if Israel launches ground assault on Gaza Strip
description: Israeli troops are reportedly preparing for a ground invasion of Gaza in response to the attacks by Hamas militants. The invasion would be complex due to Gaza's dense population and underground tunnels. It would also result in heavy casualties and could escalate the conflict into a broader regional war. The situation is further complicated by the presence of hostages and the potential involvement of neighboring countries and Iran.

title: 2016 Pathankot attack handler Shahid Latif shot dead in Pakistan mosque
description: Latif, chief handler of the fidayeen squad that attacked the Pathankot airbase in 2016, was on Tuesday gunned down by unidentified assailants inside a mosque in Sialkot, Pakistan. According to local press, Latif was shot by point blank range by shooters who were aware of the local topography. In a pre-dawn attack on January 2, 2016, a group of heavily armed Pakistani terrorists belonging to JeM outfit, struck at the IAF base in Pathankot.

title: Maharashtra Police gets new Mahindra XUV700 SUVs: Details
description: Apart from XUV700, the new fleet, which also includes a few Mahindra Scorpio Classics, a Maruti Suzuki Ciaz as well as a bunch of Force minibuses, has been bought for Akola Police in Maharashtra by District Planning Development Committee (DPDC) fund worth Rs 2.81 crore.

title: Sensex surges 500pts, Nifty nears 19.8k; all you need to know
description: The BSE Sensex surged by 500 points, reaching 66,538, while the Nifty50 traded at 19,827, marking a gain of 136 points around 10.50 am.

title: 'Electricity in Gaza to run out within hours after Israeli cutoff'
Skoda Slavia Matte Edition launched at Rs 15.52L
description: The Skoda Slavia Matte Edition is based on the range-topping Style trim, and costs Rs 40,000 more than the corresponding variants.

title: Hamas attack: Kerala nurses in Israel have no plans to return
description: Many nurses from Kerala, India are choosing to stay in Israel despite the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. The nurses, who work as caregivers in Israel, are attracted by the higher salaries and better working conditions compared to what they would receive in India. They believe they are safe in their workplaces, with security rooms and alarms in place to warn them of any danger. The Kerala government agency responsible for expat affairs has confirmed that no nurses have requested assistance to return home. However, the nurses do face challenges, such as being unable to bring their families with them.

title: Man gets day's jail for rash driving in 17-yr-old case
description: The convict was driving a tractor-trolley on April 20, 2006, when he hit a man identified as Furkan Ahmed in Haridwar’s Manglaur area. Babbu alias Balbir was sentenced to a day's imprisonment for rash and negligent driving in the 17-year-old case in which a person died. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 2,000 on him.

title: Secretive Hamas commander masterminded the attack on Israel
description: The recent attack by Hamas on Israel is being considered by Israel as its 9/11 moment and is referred to by Hamas as the Al Aqsa Flood. The attack was triggered by Israel's storming of the Al Aqsa mosque during Ramadan, leading to anger among Palestinians. The mastermind behind the assault, Mohammed Deif, rarely speaks and never appears in public. He is the commander of Hamas's Al Qassam Brigades and is believed to be in Gaza.

title: R Balki: Amitabh Bachchan is only one who is saying he is older than he really is
description: As Amitabh Bachchan celebrates his 81st birthday today, filmmaker R Balki expresses his admiration for the legendary star. Balki shares that he is amused by the way Big B carries himself and how he looks younger than his age. The filmmaker is convinced that Mr. Bachchan is the only person who is saying he is older than his actual age,. Balki has worked with Amitabh on popular Bollywood films like 'Paa' and 'Cheeni Kum'; the filmmaker's admiration towards the actor is known to all.

title: Virat Kohli-Naveen-ul-Haq duel set to corner spotlight
description: Afghanistan's upcoming match against India has garnered attention due to the feud between Naveen-ul-Haq and Virat Kohli. Indian cricket has played a significant role in the development of Afghan cricket, with players idolizing Indian cricketers. The IPL has also been instrumental in boosting their confidence. A strong performance against India would further elevate Afghanistan's reputation in the cricket world.

title: Modi govt mulls giving more cash support to small farmers
description: The Indian government is considering increasing cash support to small farmers by one-third, in an effort to gain support from this key voting bloc ahead of elections. The plan involves raising the annual direct cash transfer to small farmers from Rs 6,000 to Rs 8,000. If approved, this would cost the government an additional Rs 200 billion. The government is also exploring options to relax rules and include more farmers under the direct cash transfer program.

title: Pakistan will go with the same plan vs India: Rizwan
description: Pakistan's batting hero Mohammad Rizwan, who scored 131 not out and in the company of opener Abdullah Shafique (113) set the platform for chasing a daunting 345-run target with 10 balls to spare, said the Green Shirts will go with the same plan against India on October 14 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: Sedan ‘flies’ mid-air, lands on another car
Dussehra rally: Shinde-led Sena drops plan for Shivaji Park
description: The Shiv Sena has withdrawn its application to hold its annual Dussehra rally at Dadar's Shivaji Park, allowing the BMC to give permission to the Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena. The Shinde Sena is likely to hold its rally at Azad Maidan or Cross Maidan instead. Last year, the Bombay High Court ordered the BMC to give permission to the Uddhav faction to hold its rally at Shivaji Park. Uddhav Thackeray has emphasized the importance of tradition and culture in holding the rally at Shivaji Park.

title: Mentally ill son guards mom’s corpse for 4 days
World Cup: India hope for easier outing against Afghanistan
description: Ahead of their match against Afghanistan, the Indian cricket team opted for a light training session with only half the team present, including none of the frontline bowlers. The team management is focused on workload management and has planned optional training sessions throughout the World Cup. India aims to secure a defining lead in the points table early in the tournament and boost their net run rate.

title: Actor clicks on link to update KYC for PAN card, loses Rs 1.5L
description: Bollywood actor-producer Aftab Shivdasani lost Rs1.5 lakh from his bank account after falling for a fraudulent link to update Know Your Customer (KYC) details. He received a message stating that his account would be suspended if he didn't update his PAN card details and clicked on the link provided. As soon as he clicked on the link, he received a call asking for his banking M-Pin, following which the money was siphoned from his account. The cyber wing of the Bandra police is investigating the case.

title: Spl trains from Mum-Ahm for Ind-Pak cricket World Cup match
Cryptocurrency stolen from Delhi lands in Hamas wallets
description: The Delhi Police's Special Cell investigated a case of cryptocurrency theft from a businessman's wallet. Israel's intelligence agency, Mossad, provided information about suspect wallets operated by terrorist groups, including the al Qassam brigades of Hamas. The Special Cell's Intelligence Fusion & Strategic Ops unit discovered that some of the wallets that received stolen assets were operated by the cyber terrorism wing of Hamas. Israeli authorities froze cryptocurrency accounts held by Hamas and urged Binance to transfer the seized funds. This is the first instance of Hamas' activity in India.

title: 102-yr-old sprinter in saree gets set for 100-metre event in UP
description: At the age of 102, Kalawati is gearing up to participate in a 100-meter race at the Sansad Khel Pratiyogita Kashi-2023. Inspired by PM Narendra Modi's efforts to promote sports, Kalawati registered for the event. Her life has been a marathon of overcoming adversity, starting from being married at the age of 10 and later deciding to part ways with her husband. Despite the challenges, she took care of her family's farms and emerged as the grand matriarch. With her interest in sports and fitness, Kalawati's family decided to ensure her participation in the event, enrolling her in the 60+ category.

title: UP raises retirement age of govt docs from 62 to 65
description: The Yogi Adityanath cabinet in Lucknow has approved a new retirement policy for doctors, allowing them to retire at the age of 65 instead of 62. Under the new policy, doctors can choose to retire voluntarily or give up administrative positions and continue working as a medical professional for three more years. Doctors on administrative posts will still retire at 62. This decision will affect around 14,000 doctors working in government healthcare facilities, addressing the shortage of doctors in the sector.
